basic_info.description: üëã I'm Lauren. I am a software developer with a background in project management and IT analysis. I am interested in a role as a software developer because I have gained an expertise in IT project management, writing use cases, and documenting requirements for software with the King County Sheriff.  I have worked hard to complement these skills by learning to code in an accelerated bootcamp and I am excited to continue my career where I help people every day. Something interesting that I just fixed at work is our crime map. Working closely with our vendor City Protect, we backfilled our third party API, which provides statistics on incidents in King County neighborhoods.üó∫Ô∏è

projects.title: Recipe Reservoir
projects.description: A digital space to input and rate recipes, as well as search for user entries based on available ingredients. The project also included a conversion page.

projects.title: Odd Duck
projects.description: A voting application to capture user input to guide product devlopment. The application displays user input in a graph after voting is completed.

projects.title: Gallery of Horns
projects.description: My first app using React! It displays images and information about horned animals and allows users to filter images by number of horns and expand selected images.

experience.company: King County Sheriffs Office | Computer Resource Unit
experience.title: Functional Analyst

experience.company: King County Adult and Juvenile Detention Department
experience.title: Fiscal Specialist
